profile_positions.description:
> My PhD research aims to generate empirically grounded knowledge on how design-led resilience planning can transform coastal areas to be climate-resilient.
> I provide input into the theoretical discourse on the interface of design and planning by conceptualizing design-led planning for transformative change in coastal regions
> I conduct an empirical analysis to uncover how the ambition of transformative change shapes design-led planning practices
> In my first paper, I compare design-led planning practices in the cases of Rebuild by Design (USA) and Water as Leverage (Asia)
> The findings from this study will contribute toward further understanding of design-led planning initiatives focused on building climate resilience in coastal areas, and the mechanisms for the successful implementation of climate resilience initiatives. It also provides insight into the enabling institutional conditions for transformative change in coastal areas
profile_positions.title: PhD Candidate | Transformation by Design: Building Climate Resilience in Coastal Areas

profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description:
After I graduated from my research master in the Netherlands I wanted to apply the skills that I learned to help the development of Indonesia. As an independent consultant, I provided translation (Indonesian into English) and document editing services. 
My main client was the Indonesian Ministry of Public Works. An example of a project I worked on was a planning guideline. This document was supposed to be accessible also for non-Indonesian speakers.  Because of my native English skills, I was hired to ensure that the language of the document used the correct English terminology and to reduce ambiguity. This shows that the ministry trusted me to ensure the confidentiality of the documents that I worked on.
The translation and editing skills that I honed during this job have helped me during my career as a researcher. In later jobs, I have used these skills to produce many English reports that were based on Indonesian data and vice versa.
